definition: to have an easy time/(feel) well
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
(experienced action marker)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: It is better to weed out the bad businesses within the group rather than cross-subsidise them to save face.
sentences.chinese: 將集團內的不良業務剔除，好過爲了面子予以挽救。

sentences.english: It's better to give bad news honestly than to try to sugarcoat it.
sentences.chinese: 誠實地公佈壞消息要好過遮遮掩掩。

sentences.english: It is better to die with honour than to live with shame.
sentences.chinese: 光榮而死，好過含辱苟活。

sentences.english: And they were good longer- some of them were even better longer.
sentences.chinese: 加長版的其實也不錯，有些甚至好過實際播出的片子。

sentences.english: He feels better than he has ever felt before.
sentences.chinese: 他從來沒感覺這麼好過。

sentences.english: Money is better than poverty, if only for financial reasons.
sentences.chinese: 有錢好過貧窮，這只是基於財務上的原因。

sentences.english: But way too many badly run high-end [malls] that won't do well.
sentences.chinese: 但是，太多經營不善的高端商場的日子不會好過。

sentences.english: It is better than the spring tobacco Liuan cross passionate.
sentences.chinese: 它實在好過春光裏煙柳暗渡的嫵媚多情。

sentences.english: It is better to die for the Emperor than to live for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 爲你的帝皇犧牲好過爲你自己活著。

sentences.english: Those typists at the office never do anything right!
sentences.chinese: 辦公室的那些打字員從來沒把事幹好過。

sentences.english: In terms of jobs, journalistic occupations are outperforming the overall economy.
sentences.chinese: 就就業而言，新聞業的情況要好過總體經濟。

sentences.english: When times are good, however, they are quick to hire new hands.
sentences.chinese: 可是，當日子好過的時候，它們又很容易僱傭到新手。

sentences.english: The mild stimulant makes the hardships of life in Mogadishu feel more bearable.
sentences.chinese: 這種淡味的刺激物使得摩加迪沙生活的艱難略爲好過。

sentences.english: It's never been so good to be a four eyes.
sentences.chinese: 成爲四眼的感覺從沒這樣好過。

sentences.english: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
sentences.chinese: 給予一顆心以溫暖的行動好過千個頭瞌下去向神禱告。

sentences.english: Her family has had an easier and easier time these last few years.
sentences.chinese: 這幾年她家的日子越來越好過了。

definition: at the minimum/at the very least
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
would rather/better
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
in a word/in short/in brief
really/indeed
actually/in fact/really
improbable/unlikely/will not (act, happen etc)/not able/not having learned to do sth/(coll.) (Tw) don't mention it/not at all
to compare/to dispute/compared to/(before adj.) relatively/comparatively/rather/also pr. [jiao3]
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
surname Ying
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
always/to assemble/gather/total/overall/head/chief/general/in every case
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
